comment: The class was tedious, but easy. You'll read a play, read some articles/listen to a lecture or two about it, and do some sort of activity (essay, discussion post, etc.) about it. While we did read a few things from the textbook, most of the information was available online. It was a little boring, but he tried to make it as interesting as possible!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: I really enjoyed Shakespeare with Dr. Botelho—he's funny, laid-back, and cares about his students. You'll study seven plays and be graded on a scene annotation, performance (not acting skills), play analysis, project, and final essay. Attendance and keeping up with readings are key—go to class, do the work, and you'll do well.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: Overall, Dr. Botelho is such an entertaining professor and always manages to make going to class worth it somehow. He does not give much feedback on assignments though.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: warning: there are only four grades for the whole semester so it is very easy to fail
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: One of the best professors I have had at KSU! He genuinely cares about his class and the students. You MUST come to class and buy a textbook (got mine used for $30), & go see a play at the Shakespeare Tavern in ATL. Very unique class and I wish more teachers were like Dr. Botelho. Take his class!!!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Botelho provides amazing reading throughout the class. He also is very accessible, and loves student participation. Beware: you will have to move desks into a circle, and then back into rows every class haha.

I took this summer class online for 8 weeks, it's a lot of reading. I only had 5 grades so it's important to prepare consistently before the test/papers bc it's easy to get behind. Prof Botelho's lectures were fun and you can tell he's knowledgeable and passionate. Make sure work is detailed bc he wants you to deep dive into topics and statements.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Graded by few things

comment: Lectures are very important when taking this class! If you miss a class, make sure that you get the notes. It's not really a class you can afford to miss. There's not many graded assignments, but there is out of class work to prepare you for the upcoming lectures. Overall, he is a pretty funny guy and makes the class interesting.

Professor Botelho is my favorite professor at KSU! He is very clear about his assignment instructions and he is extremely engaging during class. He does ask for you to read and pay attention during class, but after the first week or two it is easy to grasp what he wants you to read. The big assignments are not complicated and he grades generously.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: His lectures are so funny and you can tell he is really passionate about what he is teaching. Be prepared to be involved as he does a lot of large group discussions, but it is really easy to give feedback since he is really encouraging and leads the class in the right direction. He assigns a lot of reading, but they're really interesting. Take him!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Hilarious

comment: Dr. Botelho is a great person who seems to really care about all of his students. While I loved being in class with him, he is a tough grader. He does not just give out A's to everyone and he makes it hard to earn them. Attendance is mandatory and he is not lenient on deadlines.
I love Keith Botelho he is my favorite professor of all time

Botelho is a really likable guy and he has fun in class. You have to put the work in-- weekly posts and several big projects/papers-- but he sets you up for success. Class time is mostly discussion, and he makes it enjoyable and interesting. You only get 3 unexcused absences, but he is pretty understanding. Would definitely recommend Dr. Botelho!

I absolutely loved this class! He limits the number of people in his classes so there are only about 20 people in them. It gives you the chance to all truly connect. He is passionate about what he teaches, and most of the class is just sitting around a table having group discussions. He picks great books to read, I highly recommend him!

I have now had the pleasure of having Dr. Botelho for multiple classes and I love his style. He is passionate about each class that he teaches and values discussion. He genuinely wants our opinion on topics, and he is asks for people to disagree and explain. Great guy and a great class! I will be looking to take more of his classes in the future.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: I really love this guy, enjoyed his lectures a lot and this class is easier if you do the reading. He was nice but punctual and formal. Get on his good side and he's a good person to know. I'll be making an effort to take more classes with him in the future.

BEST PROFESSOR EVER. Botelho makes learning fun and interesting, there's never anything you do that is meaningless in his class. He is hilarious and willing to help you whenever you need. Great mentor, and inspiration. You won't do well in his class if you don't actively participate or put in effort, he can clearly tell if you haven't done the work

I LOVED BOTELHO!! I'm taking two of his classes next semester, and I'm incredibly excited. Not only is he a fantastic, funny, and compassionate professor, he knows so much! And he wants to SHARE THAT WITH YOU! Let him!!! And appreciate it! He's such a good guy all around, and he's one of the few professors I'd look forward to seeing each week!

I loved this teacher. You wont regret taking him. He makes learning about Shakespeare interesting. He will do pop quizzes on the reading so make sure you read for that purpose. Turn in ALL assignments on time because he does not except them late. He's funny and I would take him again.
Engaging lectures, and awesome projects. He's basically your pops he's a blunt tough grader but you try hard for a thumbs up from him. All papers.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Participation matters

comment: Botelho has a true passion for English. Just do the reading, follow instructions, and you'll do great in his class. So much fun and I learned a ton. Also, class participation will make or break a class - he loves group conversation so participation will make it more fun.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--SO MANY PAPERS--Amazing lectures

comment: By far one of my favorite profs I've ever had. His lectures are engaging and he's a real character. Went in not really caring for Shakespeare, but he's changed my mind. It's a lot of reading, but well worth it. Would definitely take him again.
Hard grader. Best prof around though.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Tough Grader

comment: Dr. Botelho is the absolute best! If you ever have the chance to take him, do it! You'll learn more than you would have ever expected. Shakespeare is the 3rd course with him which I was afraid of b/c my previous teachers butcher Shakespeare, but he knows how to teach his students. I learned so much! Don't be afraid of the final, just come to class.

One of the best professors in the KSU English department. If you want to take Shakespeare, you MUST take his class. He's one of the most interesting, engaging teachers I've ever had, and a great person on the whole. I regret not taking him for 2145, because his way of teaching you methodology and research is the best.

Literally one of my new favorite profs. He's such a great guy, and he actually made me appreciate Shakespeare (whom I wasn't a huge fan of at first)! The class is a little challenging, but you learn so much. The final exam is probably the scariest thing, but it's not bad if you really think through it. Any class of his would be great, though!

This will be my third time taking Botelho, and I am already signed up for another class with him. HE IS MY FAVORITE PROF AT KSU!!! Hands down. Hilarious, super enthusiastic, and so smart about every topic he teaches. He has made me fall even deeper in love with literature, even the worst parts of it. You will not be disappointed!

Dr. Botelho was one of the best professors i've ever taken. he's also probably one of the hardest. Read everything and pay attention to lectures. Take good notes. Read about 9 plays; you get tested on 8 of them at the final. He's very specific.  A few other papers during the semester but not much else to reinforce what you read. Very passable.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: AMAZING professor!!! He is by far my favorite professor. He opened my eyes going into the English department! He has very clear standards and is extremely helpful! You have to read a lot, but his book choices are wonderful. I couldn't have asked for a better professor & I will be taking him again.
Dr. Botehlo is great!! I'm not a fan of Shakespeare, but he has made me enjoy reading the plays. He is so funny and down to earth, which makes class enjoyable.

He is by far one of the best teachers I have ever had. I took my restorative literature credit with him and have never learned so much in one semester. There is TONS of reading that is ABSOLUTELY MANDATORY but if you read and participate in class, you have a good chance of passing. I made an A in the class even after a rough start to the semester.

Botelho is THE best prof I've ever had. He challenges you to think differently and to delve in deep. He's passionate, approachable, hilarious, and fun to just shoot the breeze with! He brought about a passion in me I never knew I could possess, and now I'm a Shax nerd and loving it! Tough class but SO worth taking. Go to class. Read the text.

Dr. Botelho is absolutely fantastic. I have never had a class where I loved the discussions as much as I do in this class. He involves everyone in the small-style classroom. Though it is not the easiest class in the world, it is fair. If you actually want to learn and take something from an English class, TAKE HIM.

He's a tough grader, but he is so awesome that you respect him and want to impress him. I learned SO much about Shakespeare and found a new love for him even stroer than before. It's not an easy A at all; he rarely gives As. But it's worth taking, he's so passionate and fun.

I didn't know what to expect going into this class but I left with the most rewarding feeling.I honestly didn't want the class to end. Expect to work, but also expect to have one of the most satisfying learning experiences of your college career. Botelho knows how to run a class and to run it well. He's also extremely personable. Take him!

GREAT PROFESSOR!  I honestly wasn't looking forward to taking an entire class on Shakespeare.  However, I found it to be a million times better because of this professor.  Because of him I now have a love affair with Shax.  Great class, hard grader, makes you work, but worth every minute.
Very entertaining, hard grader.

BEST PROFESSOR EVER! He makes Shakespeare come to life and so much more interesting than any teacher I've had before has. He uses a bunch of different mediums to teach you so it's not just him lecturing. And he also makes you act out a scene but it isn't bad at all you could even get a part that has no lines. If you take it, you must have Botelho!
Please take this course from Dr. Bowers.  You will learn quite a bit and she is fun.  She is not anal retentive, like this professor.  Shakespeare should be enjoyable not a chore.
He is crazy, but keeps things interesting especially with his Shax collection. You have to attend 1 play, and write some small papers. I'd take his Shax in film class, but schedule already full.

If you are at all interested in Shakespeare, this is the professor to take it with. He is very enthusiastic about his subject. It was through this class that I actually came to appreciate Shakespeare, and his Shakespeare in pop culture assignments really make you realize just how ingrained the Bard is in our culture.

This professor was amazing. Obviously loved the subject matter and the man knows his stuff. I found him very approachable and not stuffy or elitist at all. Class discussions were well developed and interesting and he has a wonderful ability to tease the thoughts and ideas about the plays out of his students. Highly Recommend.

Class:Theory-based Literature- I wish I'd had more profs like him in my undergrad prog. He's tough, though! Expect group projects, deep analytical assigns./exams, student-led roundtable discussion/ participation,& very heavy reading load. He has high expectations, but you'll thank yourself for the experience after your're finished with the course!

I thought I would love this class and I did but I had to miss a few classes because of work so that brought my B down to a D eventhough I didn't miss any of the assignments or test.  So take this classs if you have a lot of time to read (and I mean A LOT)and will never miss a class because it will effect your grade!

He scares you the first week of class, but he is not as tough as he would have you believe. Botelho loves Shakespeare, so the lectures and assignments are interesting and mostly fun. Yes, you work hard, but it's a 4000-level class, what do you expect?

I was excited to take this Shakespeare class, as it was the only one I would experience in my college career, but I left very disappointed. The teacher comes off as elitist, snobbish. He doesn't want opinions on the writings, because his is the only one that counts. At least that's how he came off. Why is Shakespeare required anyway?

I took Bothelo for Shakespeare and Shakespeare in Film. One of my favorite teachers of all time. He has very high expectations of his students but if you are serious about learning you will gain a lot of knowledge from him.

I'm a history major, and took this class because there just isn't an equivalent history course.  As such, this class was a perfect example of a class one should be able to count two ways.  Botelho was interesting, informative, knew his stuff and managed to keep the class on track.

Pretty cool professor. I thought he took shakespeare a little too serious. Although I passed the class, I still can't figure out was the fuss over this cat shakespeare. Personally I think he's a fraud.

Botelho is fantastic. This was a topics class-Shax on Film. There were 4 film responses, quizzes on each play, one group project, and a final paper. Relatively easy A if you keep up with the work. Definitely recommend him to serious students.

Very smart, talented, good sense of humor. Really knows his stuff. The class is hard. He makes you -- forces you -- to think. But he makes you want to do well. He inspires you to do your best, not just BS your way through the semester. Intense class. Plus, he's cute.

This was the Shakespeare class (I can't remember the course number). Dr. Botelho was a tough, but fair teacher.  No BS in this class.  Definitely not an easy A, but a great class and a great professor.  In fact, he jump-started my interest in Shakespeare.  He made the Bard accessible and relevant--with techniques I'll try when teaching teens.

Botelho is one of the top three teachers I've had in my entire life. Seriously. Funny guy, insanely smart, passionate about what he does, always there to help students. There's a lot of reading, and essays have a very low tolerance for BS - but if you actually want to LEARN, take his class. I've had three of them so far, taking another over summer.

Great professor, extremely smart and funny too. He has high expectations of his students, so expect to work a little. Midterm and final are each worth 25% of your grade so STUDY. He's great at making connections between texts and bringing outside information into discussions--very well-rounded lectures. Take him!

This was a fun class. He was really entertaining to listen to. But expect a lot of reading. The quizes were difficult because he expected you to pick up on every little detail. But the grades on the papers were fair. Overall a great class.
Its a tough class. A lot of work is involved. However, he is very funny to listen to.
head of the department...AWESOME!!!

I just wrote the review below for ENG 4372 British Renaissance Lit and it showed up with a sad face but i don't know why i loved this class and recommend it even if u have to bust ur a** in it. This review and the following one should both have happy faces next 2 them!

BritRenaissance Lit-focus on women writers. Fascinating class but amounts to PT job if u want an A. LOTS of books & papers! MUST keep up with the reading & attend class; he rewards good writing. He's fun but has a low BS tolerance-don't try! Great lectures, books & discussions. Most interesting class EVER. Take it, but plan to work ur tail off!

His attendance policy is strict (only one absence, then it affects your grade), and the course workload is large, but if you read the assignemnts, show up for class, and talk, you will get a good grade
Good guy, great attendance policy, great book discussion. Will help you with just about any questions you have regarding lit.
Expect to be pushed to work hard in this class.  But if you do, you will make a good grade.

Very challenging work in this Shakespeare class. You must be "on the ball," so to speak. He has high expectations of his upper level students, but very personable and open to conversations outside class. Gave me a healthy appreciation for Shax. The work load is substantial, but if you like an interesting, intelligent, engaging prof, take Botelho.
sexy and smart. mmmm.

He is pretty cool. Offers extra credit. Has pretty cool assignments. Does give pop quizzes about every week, but not too hard. Does go over everything in class. Has a 2 question final. Is super funny. Loves the Boston Red Sox. Has a fast grading turn around time on assignments. Offer many different medias to teach. LOVES Shakespeare.

Botelho is one of my favorite professors. He is not the easiest but he will ensure that you actually learn the material. I've taken him for 2 courses so far and would take more! He is really personable and loves to crack jokes and be friendly with his students. Don't take him if you want to slack all semester but do if you want an interesting prof!

Grading is far too subjective. Too much reading...and I love to read. The final exam counts too much. I nursed a 'B' throughout the semester only to drop to a 'C' due to the final. I passed Shakespeare with a 'B' from the same prof; he is a nice guy it's just a crap shoot as to how he is going to decide to grade you.

Hate english but loved this class. Class was always very interesting. We learned a lot. You have to make sure to read all the books and participate in discussions. You'll do fine! He really enjoys when people go to his office to see him!!!

Dr. Botelho is an amazing teacher.  His course is tough but it challenges you which is good.  And yes, he does require a lot of reading but, ahem, if you're an English major you should be used to that right??  He's a really funny and personable guy, and keeps the class interesting with odd stories about the material that they never tell you in the

Requires an extreme amount of reading.  I got a little behind because I missed two days due to a work-related trip, and I was forced to drop the class because I couldn't get caught up.  He teaches like he's still teaching high school.  I was not fond of his style.  He brought in too much information, rather than focusing on the literature itself.

Encourages students to read and analyze works as a sociology student, not English students. Requires knowledge of not just literature, but relavent social issues of the time they were written. Not to mention reading a ridiculous amount of material every night. Bad teacher if you are an English major because you're interested in English.

Interesting lectures and encourages you to think on your own...BUT requires WAY too much reading! If you have a job, more than 2-3 other classes, or just any other responsibilities (a life!) outside of school, I would not recommend him for any upper level course.

Well...he's very interesting to say the least.  He really is a character...funny and very into english.  Umm...he requires SO much reading and has several pop quizzes...or maybe not; he likes suprising you.  Tests are quote id and essays and you need to be really specific on them.  He doesn't have many assignments, but when he does, they req work.
